Package gui

Class OpenFileDialog

java.lang.Object
gui.OpenFileDialog
public class OpenFileDialog
extends java.lang.Object
Opens the native file dialog and supports choosing a single file to return its file path has a string literal, and saving a file using the file dialog. There are additional methods to see the source path that the file dialog will open from, set the filter list for files, and a toggle for displaying console logs of actions.
Author:
Thomas

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.String filePath  
    private java.lang.String filterList  
    private java.lang.String openFromPath  
    private java.lang.Boolean showPrint  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    OpenFileDialog()
    Constructor to sets the initial file dialog settings to be: (1) filter list is set for .asm and .txt files, (2) opens from the default OS path, (3) console prints statements are not shown.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void checkResult​(int result, org.lwjgl.PointerBuffer path)
    Handles the file dialog options.
    void displayConsole​(boolean option)
    Set whether to display console prints.
    java.lang.String getFilePath()
    Returns the file path of a selected file from the file dialog.
    void openFileWindow()
    Opens the file dialog from either the default os path or a defined path to open a file.
    void saveFileWindow()
    Opens the file dialog from either the default os path or a defined path to save a file.
    void saveFolderWindow()
    Opens the file dialog from either the default os path or a defined path to save a file.
    void setDefaultFilePath​(java.lang.String fpath)
    Set the default file path that the file dialog will open from.
    void setFilterList​(java.lang.String flist)
    Set the filter list for the file dialog.

  • Constructor Details

    • OpenFileDialog

      public OpenFileDialog()
      Constructor to sets the initial file dialog settings to be: (1) filter list is set for .asm and .txt files, (2) opens from the default OS path, (3) console prints statements are not shown.

  • Method Details

    • setDefaultFilePath

      public void setDefaultFilePath​(java.lang.String fpath)
      Set the default file path that the file dialog will open from. NOTE: Does not check for path validation...
      Parameters:
      fpath - a string literal

    • setFilterList

      public void setFilterList​(java.lang.String flist)
      Set the filter list for the file dialog. i.e. "asm,txt,c,png" ...
      Parameters:
      flist - a string literal

    • getFilePath

      public java.lang.String getFilePath()
      Returns the file path of a selected file from the file dialog.
      Returns:
      string literal of file path or if no file path selected null

    • displayConsole

      public void displayConsole​(boolean option)
      Set whether to display console prints. By default no console prints are shown.
      Parameters:
      option - true to display console prints and false to not.

    • openFileWindow

      public void openFileWindow()
      Opens the file dialog from either the default os path or a defined path to open a file.

    • saveFileWindow

      public void saveFileWindow()
      Opens the file dialog from either the default os path or a defined path to save a file.

    • saveFolderWindow

      public void saveFolderWindow()
      Opens the file dialog from either the default os path or a defined path to save a file.

    • checkResult

      private void checkResult​(int result, org.lwjgl.PointerBuffer path)
      Handles the file dialog options. A single file path is set to filePath. Whether prints to console display depends if showPrint was set to true or false
